timeline.bodyText:

It will be a bit weird when we break one to not know which one exactly :)

replies.bodyText: I could split and do the whole onEachOperator ceremony in multiple shorter tests, but note that we'll know which case breaks exactly thanks to the as description of each assert...
replies.author: simonbasle

replies.bodyText:
btw resetOnEachOperator can to go @AfterTest, so that the test becomes a 2-3 liner

replies.author: bsideup

timeline.message:
fix #2055 Flux#from and Mono#flux apply onAssembly hooks + wrap API

This commit streamlines the from vs wrap semantics of conversions,
where `wrap` is introduced in `Mono` (also as a package private method).

Additionally the `from` methods delegates a maximum to `wrap`, and the
`wrap` semantics are exposed in the public API in `Hooks`. This is
because the differentiator is that these methods don't apply hooks,
which makes them potentially valuable in setting up simple assembly
hooks.

We also take that commit as an opportunity to improve the lift operators
`stepName()` method, which delegates to the lifted publisher.

timeline.author: bsideup

timeline.bodyText: May I ask why not parameterized? :)
timeline.author: bsideup

replies.bodyText: didn't go through the trouble, as splitting the test was enough vs changing the test runner and dealing with the boilerplate of providing params (plus with independent tests the name can reflect the style of source, not the concrete name of the operator used)
replies.author: simonbasle
